layoutObject.title: Instructions for New Tenants
layoutObject.description: Instructions to help a new tenant get started
layoutObject.staticContent:
To configure a new district, district administrators (tenant administrators) should perform the following steps:

  1. Upload your district logo to replace the text logo placeholder
    1. Move the cursor over the district logo placeholder at the top left of the page and click on the 'gear' icon that appears to launch the rich editor
    2. Click in the content area and delete the placeholder text.
    3. Click on the Image icon to upload your district logo.  On the Image Properties dialog, click the Upload tab.  Click the 'Choose File' button, select your file, then click the 'Send it to Server' button, then click OK.
    4. Click on the Save icon near the top left in the row of icons to save your changes.
  2. Configure the skin color to match your districts color scheme.
    1. Click on the 'Manage This Skin' link on the Tenant Administration tab.
    2. Check the box to enable Dynamic Skins.  Do not change the skin name!
    3. Select your color choices and Save.
  3. Register and configure new instances of App Launcher portlets (see below)

Creating new App Launchers

  1. On the Tenant Administration, click on Register Portlets.
  2. Click Register New Portlet button.  Select the App Launcher portlet type
  3. Enter a title that will display in the Portlet List and the Customize drawer.
  4. Click the Edit Principals button.  You must add your tenant group name so users can view the app launcher.  Click 'Add to Selection' button next to your district name on the top left and then click 'Save' near the bottom right. Leave both Browse and Subscribe checked.
  5. Click the Edit Categories button.  You must add your category '<tenantName> Portlets' to be able to manage the app launcher portlet.  Click 'Add to Selection' and 'Save'
  6. Set the Lifecycle State to 'Published' so users can see the app launcher.
  7. Click 'Save and Configure' to configure the App Launcher.
    1. Enter the URL to launch; e.g. http://www.google.com
    2. Set Display to New Window
    3. Click 'Upload' to upload the icon to display on the app launcher. Click 'Select File', select the file on your filesystem. When done click 'Upload'
    4. Enter the link title that appear when the mouse hovers over the app launcher icon
    5. Enter the title and description that appear under the app launcher icon
    6. Click Save
  8. Add the new app launcher to the '<tenantName>' tab
    1. Select the Tenant Admin tab.
    2. In Fragment Administration, select the district in the drop-down then click Go.
    3. On the '<tenantName>' tab, click Customize.  Select the new app launcher and place it on the page in the desired location.  Tip: Click on the '<tenantName> Portlets' category to find the portlet, or search for it.
    4. When done, click the 'Exit' button in the Fragment Administration banner at the top.

layoutObject.title: Welcome to uPortal
layoutObject.staticContent:
What is uPortal?

uPortal is a free and open source Java-implemented web portal platform developed and maintained by participants drawn from across higher education under the coordination of Apereo. uPortal can aggregate content, present self-service applications, personalize presentation and content on the basis of groups and user attributes, drive mobile device applications, and allow advanced end-user-participatory customization of the portal experience. uPortal supports the JSR-286 and JSR-168 Java portlet specification for including your custom applications within the portal.

Welcome to uPortal.

layoutObject.title: Logging in
layoutObject.staticContent:
How and why to log in

As you can see, uPortal can aggregate and present content generically for unauthenticated users. When users log in, uPortal can do much more, with personalized content, customized layouts, group membership, and access control. Use the "Sign in" button at the top of the page with these example username and password pairs for the example users included with uPortal.

UsernamePasswordComments
studentstudentMocked up student content
adminadmin Be sure to change this password! The admin user can administer many aspects of the portal, including publishing new content and editing access control.
developerdeveloper Be sure to change this password! The developer user can administer many aspects of the portal, including publishing new content and editing access control.
facultyfacultyMocked up faculty content
staffstaffMocked up staff content

layoutObject.title: Welcome to uPortal
layoutObject.staticContent:
What is uPortal?

uPortal is a free and open source Java-implemented web portal platform developed and maintained by participants drawn from across higher education under the coordination of Apereo. uPortal can aggregate content, present self-service applications, personalize presentation and content on the basis of groups and user attributes, drive mobile device applications, and allow advanced end-user-participatory customization of the portal experience. uPortal supports the JSR-286 and JSR-168 Java portlet specification for including your custom applications within the portal.

Welcome to uPortal.

layoutObject.title: Welcome to uPortal
layoutObject.staticContent:
What is uPortal?

uPortal is a free and open source Java-implemented web portal platform developed and maintained by participants drawn from across higher education under the coordination of Apereo. uPortal can aggregate content, present self-service applications, personalize presentation and content on the basis of groups and user attributes, drive mobile device applications, and allow advanced end-user-participatory customization of the portal experience. uPortal supports the JSR-286 and JSR-168 Java portlet specification for including your custom applications within the portal.

Welcome to uPortal.

Conference Planning To-do List

  1. Select the date
  2. Create promotional plan
    • email campaign
    • web site
    • print materials
  3. Book facilities
    • Select building
    • Book rooms
  4. Book caterer
  5. Book block of hotel rooms
  6. Develop a conference daily schedule of events
  7. Book speakers
    • Keynote

  8. Plan the registration process
    • Deadline for early bird and final registrations
    • Create/enter data into database

layoutObject.title: Welcome to uPortal
layoutObject.staticContent:
What is uPortal?

uPortal is a free and open source Java-implemented web portal platform developed and maintained by participants drawn from across higher education under the coordination of Apereo. uPortal can aggregate content, present self-service applications, personalize presentation and content on the basis of groups and user attributes, drive mobile device applications, and allow advanced end-user-participatory customization of the portal experience. uPortal supports the JSR-286 and JSR-168 Java portlet specification for including your custom applications within the portal.

Welcome to uPortal.
